title: NFL Draft 2021: Giants and Eagles land stud wide receivers in mock draft stunner
body: Alabama wide receivers Jaylen Waddle (17) and DeVonta Smith (6) are expected to be first-round picks in the 2021 NFL Draft.There’s a big difference between want and need.The NEED a wide receiver in the  after parting ways with  andThe WANT a wideout, but don’t need to use their first-round pick on a receiver after signing and in free agency.But in ’ first mock draft, want and need converge for the NFC East rivals.Davis predicts LSU’s  will be the first wide receiver off the board, going to the  at No. 7. Florida tight end, perhaps the top pass-catcher in the draft, goes to the at No. 6.In a bit of a stunner, Davis also has North Dakota State quarterback  falling to the  at No. 15.
